intro: Corunastylis mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star sedge, is a herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or brown. It thrives in wetland or swampy environments, often growing in dense stands. Corunastylis mucronata is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and its ability to form dense vegetation in moist habitats.
